Kristinn Sigurdsson wrote:

> 1. Not as such, although there was an issue with Heritrix builds 
> failing on 2.6 kernels at some point. Myself, I'm running on Red Hat, 
> but that is simply because thats what we use here, not because 
> Heritrix runs better on it. (Michael, I think there should be a FAQ 
> entry for this question).

What would you suggest Kris?  We have this FAQ entry -- 
http://crawler.archive.org/faq.html#testsfail -- and this release note: 
http://crawler.archive.org/articles/releasenotes.html#1_4_0_limitations.  
You thinking we should talk about particular OS versions?  That might be 
a tough one since we have only limited experience  Recently we've been 
running on suse 9.3 because it holds out the (as yet unfulfilled) 
promise of a stable 64-bit JVM.  Previous we ran with recent versions of 
fedoras.  Before that it was debian but we had the release noted issues.

St.Ack
